channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases pass 5.9 million as Australian death toll stands at 103

item.dc:creator: Jim Pavlidis
item.description: “Good ordinary footballers” are eclipsed by the actions of a few champions who use a red leather ball to create moments of sublime artistry.
item.title: It's been a big week in art ... with Jim Pavlidis

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: The national men's and women's sides are almost certain not to avoid the drastic cost-cutting measures at Cricket Australia.
item.title: Langer's coaches face nervous wait as cuts loom

item.description: USA protests spread after the death of George Floyd in police custody.
item.title: USA Riots

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: After the Bronson Xerri scandal, Cronulla's misery was compounded by a 28-16 defeat at Bankwest Stadium.
item.title: 'Down and out': Tigers fight back to cap miserable week for Sharks

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The organisation has acknowledged belts will be tightened further at head office, resulting in an extra $20 million in savings next year.
item.title: NRL to slash costs by $70 million next season to keep clubs afloat

item.description: Sources said soldiers in North Carolina, New York, Colorado and Kansas have been told to be ready in case they are called to Minneapolis. The order predates the Friday protests.
item.title: Trump orders military to stand by as protests spread to several cities

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: The new Wallabies coach won't be forced to accept a salary reduction on his arrival in Australia despite widespread pay cuts for players and staff.
item.title: No plans at Rugby Australia to cut Rennie's pay despite cash crisis

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: A school in Melbourne's north-west will stay open despite a positive coronavirus test from a student but authorities insist it is safe.
item.title: Class in quarantine but school to remain open after positive test

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 31, 2020

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: The Dragons players showed their appreciation for the Warriors' commitment to the NRL when they gathered them in a huddle after full-time.
item.title: 'This means a great deal': Win just the tonic for wounded Warriors

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: The New Zealand Warriors held a team scoreless on Australian soil for just the second time in history to heap pressure on Dragons coach Paul McGregor.
item.title: 'I have a team I believe in': McGregor coy as Dragons disappoint again

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Storm star Josh Addo-Carr is appealing the fine the NRL imposed on him for breaking social-distancing laws.
item.title: Addo-Carr joins Mitchell in fighting $50,000 NRL fine

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Having missed the chance to respond effectively to the coronavirus, Trump faces another crisis with the killing of George Floyd. So far, he's fallen short.
item.title: As America burns, Trump falls short at another crisis

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: The Age's View
item.description: For two long months we have been ordered to stay in our houses. Now we cannot wait to escape them.
item.title: Take a holiday, but stay vigilant

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: The Roosters playmaker is yet to make contact with his best mate after Tuesday's bombshell news he was facing a four-year ban for performance-enhancing drugs.
item.title: 'I tried to reach out': Shattered Flanagan yet to talk with mate Xerri

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Premier trainer Chris Waller is looking to a winter dominance of the staying ranks after remarkable feature double in Sydney and Brisbane.
item.title: Wu's the man: Waller wants to stay dominant after two-state double

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: On Monday morning, experienced Brisbane journalist Neil Breen steps in to Alan Jones' radio shoes, as 4BC launches a local morning show for the first time in five years.
item.title: 'A marathon, not a sprint': Kickstarting 4BC breakfast radio after Alan Jones

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: An increase in children exposed to domestic and family violence, specifically emotional and psychological abuse, has been reported across Brisbane, Sunshine Coast and Mackay offices.
item.title: Why authorities are preparing for a 'tsunami of child abuse' cases

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: This experience of watching old games during lockdown has given me a new perspective and benchmark to compare to today's footy.
item.title: A lockdown lesson: Old footy was better

item.description: Cogliere was never meant to contest Sunday's Gunnedah Cup at Tamworth but trainer Marc Quinn thinks the six-year-old is still the one to beat.
item.title: Accidental starter Cogliere still the one to beat in Gunnedah Cup

item.description: The Gunnedah Showcase Cup headlines an eight-race card in the nearby country music capital on Sunday.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Tamworth on Sunday

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: The NRL's new six-again rule and less stoppages could see metre-eaters James Tedesco, Jason Taumalolo and co will regularly run for more than 300 metres.
item.title: 'Off-the-cuff footy will work': 300m games set to be NRL's new normal

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: The Brisbane Lions captain has been eased back into training because of a foot problem ahead of facing Fremantle when the AFL season returns.
item.title: Lions ease Zorko back as Dockers set to welcome Hogan's return

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Police believe the pair had recently broken up and were trying to get back together when the man stabbed the woman before stabbing himself at a home in Sydney's west.
item.title: Man and woman, both 22, die in 'tragic' double stabbing

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Dawn Passage has guaranteed his place in next Saturday's Stradbroke Handicap and stamped himself as one of the horses to beat in the 1400-metre group 1.
item.title: Relief for Innes jnr as Dawn Passage locks in Stradbroke berth

item.description: The MasterChef judge eloped to Joshua Tree, in California, for her rock'n'roll wedding to Joe Jones in 2017.
item.title: How Melissa Leong's wedding channelled her favourite fashion decade

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: This is no time for AFL clubs to be picking fights with each other as Saints' stalwart Gerry Ryan declared St Kilda to be on the right track for success
item.title: Saints urged to keep being aggressive

item.description: A week in photos from the award winning Sydney Morning Herald / The Age / Financial Review photographers.
item.title: Photos of the week, May 30, 2020

item.description: The pigeon's owner rejected allegations that the numbers inscribed on a ring on the bird's leg were codes meant for militant groups in disputed Kashmir.
item.title: Move over James Bond; India returns alleged bird spy to Pakistan

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Brett Horsnell's legal team was set to argue that he was made to return to the fray in a breach of the Parramatta's duty of care to him. However, Horsnell has opted against pursuing the matter.
item.title: 'I don't need the drama': Former Eels forward drops concussion case

item.description: With more than 27,000 deaths and nearly 238,000 confirmed cases of the virus, Spain is among Europe's worst-hit nations.
item.title: Spain reports suspected imported coronavirus cases from US

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: The number of university donors has soared after tertiary institutions appealed for help after many of their employees and students missed out on government coronavirus aid.
item.title: University donations grow amid coronavirus funding drives

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: The game between Australian ex-pats from London and Edinburgh was played on a medieval field in south London normally used for pig rearing.
item.title: Played in 1888 on a pig farm, tales of first Aussie rules game in England emerge

item.dc:creator: Phil Gould
item.description: The return to one on-field referee and the introduction of the six-again call for ruck infringements have quickly proven to be a masterstroke.
item.title: Make league great again: New rules a big win for the little blokes

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: The Swans wrote to the AFL requesting players more vulnerable to injury to have access to medical and strength and conditioning staff but were denied.
item.title: Swans wanted access to Franklin in lockdown to minimise injury risk

item.dc:creator: Miki Perkins
item.description: The glossy black cockatoo has been feeding on trees in Melbourne's outer suburbs, but conservationists warn this is not cause for celebration.
item.title: Rare visitor excites Melburnians, yet its presence is a sad sign

item.dc:creator: Cameron Myles
item.description: WA recorded no new active cases of COVID-19 overnight, but the state’s total grew after a historical case was identified in a crew member from the Al Kuwait livestock ship.
item.title: No fresh COVID-19 cases for WA, but state count rises as tests reveal historical case

item.dc:creator: Nicole Elphick
item.description: From a livestreamed concert from Riverside Theatres to hip-hop with the Thundamentals and a short film festival, we have your week in Sydney covered.
item.title: Best of the week: What to see, hear and do from May 31 to June 6

item.dc:creator: Louise Rugendyke
item.description: You know things have become weird in lockdown when Rob Brydon is reciting lines from a children’s book to your three-year-old in the middle of a video interview and it feels like the most normal thing that’s happened in 10 weeks.
item.title: Greece is the word for Rob Brydon: 'I do have a real fear of diminishing returns'

item.dc:creator: Nicole Elphick
item.description: For inspiration during self-isolation, each week we asked well-known Australian artists and entertainers to tell us what they are doing at home.
item.title: Home Sweet Home: What's keeping actor Roz Hammond busy as lockdown lifts

item.description: Hilde Hinton's first novel is an impressive coming-of-age story about a troubled girl.
item.title: Saying the difficult things about adolescence

item.description: From warbling on a Wodonga picket line at dawn to serenading Nelson Mandela, my choir responded to the human need to holler.
item.title: Sian Prior: Happy birthday, hollering comrades

item.description: Since my wife passed away I’ve decided to be my true self. Where can I learn how to pass as a tasteful, elegant woman?
item.title: About Last Night: I’m a heterosexual man who loves to cross dress

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Saturday Picks: Colony, Alaskan Bush People, The Dog House
item.title: TV for Saturday, June 6

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Friday Picks: Neighbours, America in Colour, Live PD: Police Patrol
item.title: TV for Friday, June 5

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Thursday Picks: The New Pope, Law & Order: SVU, Top of the Lake
item.title: TV for Thursday, June 4

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Wednesday Picks: Julia Zemiro's Home Dellivery: Jacqui Lambie, The Simpsons, On Country Kitchen
item.title: TV for Wednesday, June 3

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Tuesday Picks: Who Do You Think You Are?, How to Stay Married, Road to Now
item.title: TV for Tuesday, June 2
